name: market for helium, crude stockpiling | helium, crude stockpiling | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11837/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is the market for  'helium, crude stockpiling', in the Global geography.;This market contains no transport or losses, as they are irrelevant for the delivered product.;helium, crude stockpiling'  is an inorganic substance with a CAS no. : 007440-59-7. It is called 'helium' under IUPAC naming and its molecular formula is: He. It is gas under normal conditions of temperature and pressure and it has no odour. The substance is modelled with  >99.9% purity On a consumer level, is used in the following products: Arts, crafts, and hobby materials, fuels and related products, metal products not covered elsewhere, non-TSCA use, magnetic resonance imaging equipment, toys, playground, and sporting equipment, leak detection gas, welding gas, diving, inerting gas, coolant, lifting gas for balloons. On industrial sites, the substance is used for the manufacture of products in the following sectors: Aeronautics, Process and Balloon gas, Welding, Medical Equipment, Diving gas, Functional fluids (closed systems), Functional fluids (open systems), Process regulators, leak detection gas, welding gas, lifting gas, inerting gas, coolant.

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'helium, crude stockpiling',  within the geography of Global.

This activity ends with the supply of  helium, crude stockpiling', to the consumers of this product. Transport or losses are considered irrelevant for this product.
